One parent will have sole decision-making responsibility and will make important decisions about the child’s welfare, including health, education, culture, language, religion and spirituality, and extra-curricular activities.
Sole decision-making parent must first consult with the other parent in respect of all important decisions and provide their decision in writing in advance.

Each parent will have split decision-making authority over specific areas of the child’s welfare. Each must consult with the other before making final decisions and give written notice 30 days in advance.
If emergency medical care is needed during parenting time, the parent present must notify the other parent promptly.
Health-related decisions will be made in consultation with doctors and health specialists and based on their recommendations when necessary.
Education decisions include school selection, holding back or skipping grades, changing teachers, or switching schools.

Neither party may change the child's name without the written consent of the other.
Each party will hold and exchange the child’s documents (e.g., passport, SIN, birth certificate) as reasonably required, and return them promptly.
Either party may make inquiries and receive information from the child’s teachers, medical providers, and others involved in their care. They will sign any authorization forms if required.

category: Equal Parenting Time - Split Two-Week Rotation (2-2-5-5)

Parenting is shared across a repeating two-week schedule with clear transitions and alternating weekends.

PARTY A or PARTY B will have no parenting time until further agreement or court order.

category: Right of First Refusal – Either Parent
text: _____ and _____ agree that it is in _____'s best interests to spend time with the other party [or _____ grandparents] rather than with a third party. category: Relocation – Live Near for Parenting & Decision-Making
text: _____ and _____ will live near each other to facilitate the parenting time and the decision-making responsibility with respect to _____, as set out in this Agreement.

A party intending to relocate with or without _____ in a way that significantly impacts the other party's relationship with _____ must give at least 60 days' written notice in the form prescribed by the [applicable legislation] [Divorce Act], setting out the expected date, new address and contact information, a proposal for parenting time[ and decision-making], and any other prescribed information.

Upon receiving notice of proposed relocation, the parties will work together [independently or with counsel] to review and revise the parenting time schedule[ and decision-making responsibility] and related issues, and may mediate the dispute if needed.

If the matter is unresolved, the non-relocating party will, within 30 days, serve an objection in the prescribed form under the [Divorce Act], stating the objection, reasons, views on parenting proposals, and any other prescribed information.
If an objection is served, the dispute will be resolved by [arbitration] [mediation/arbitration] [court application], as specified in this Agreement.

If (i) the parties reach an amending agreement, (ii) the non-relocating party does not object and there is no proceeding pending, or (iii) no award or court order prohibits the move, the relocating party may move as of the date in the notice or any applicable award/order.
This relocation paragraph does not limit either party’s ability to take _____ out of the jurisdiction for travel in accordance with the travel term above.

text: If the parties have not resolved the parenting dispute after [number] days, the parenting coordinator will arbitrate the dispute[, and may reapportion costs].

"Table" and "income" mean those terms as defined in s. 2(1) of the Guidelines; "section 7 expenses" are defined in s. 7(1); "child support" includes both Table amount and section 7 expenses.
For determining child support: PARTY A income is $[amount]; PARTY B income is $[amount].
As of the Agreement date, arrears of child support owed are $[amount].
Arrears will be paid in full within [number] days of Agreement date.
Arrears will be paid in monthly installments of $[amount], starting [date], until paid in full.

category: Arrears Paid in addition to Ongoing Child Support
text: Arrears payments are in addition to ongoing child support obligations.
The parties have equal/shared parenting time. Each will pay monthly Table child support adjusted as per circumstances, and contribute to section 7 expenses.
Child lives primarily with one party, but the other has 40%+ time. Each party pays adjusted Table child support and contributes to section 7 expenses.
One party has primary parenting time. The other pays full monthly Table support and their share of section 7 expenses.
Split parenting: each party pays Table support for the child(ren) in the other’s primary care. Net amount is offset monthly.
Each party supports the child independently with no contribution from the other. This arrangement is reasonable under the Guidelines.
A lump sum child support payment of $[amount] satisfies all future child support obligations.

category: Child Support More Than Table Amount
text: A party pays more than Table amount due to increased household expenses or other valid reasons.
A party pays less than the Table amount due to special provisions benefiting the child (e.g., equity transfer, exclusive home use, lump sum).
A party pays less than Table amount due to high income exceeding $150,000. Contributions adjusted to match needs and fairness.

category: Children Over the Age of Majority
text: Reduced support is justified where the child is over the age of majority. This reflects actual dependency and fairness.
Undue hardship warrants reduced Table support due to household income disparities and financial burdens.
Undue hardship will be reviewed after one year, with disclosure exchanged and child support adjusted if applicable.

category: Fixed Termination Date For Undue Hardship
text: If undue hardship ends, the full Table amount and proportional section 7 expense sharing resumes automatically.
Section 7 expenses must be itemized annually, with each party contributing based on proportional income or fixed responsibility.

category: Payment of Section 7 Expenses - One Party
text: Section 7 expenses will be allocated as follows: one party pays specific items upfront, the other reimburses proportionally based on agreed percentages.

category: Payment of Section 7 Expenses - Both Parties
text: Each party provides written proof of incurred section 7 expenses annually. Reimbursement is calculated after applying tax credits, subsidies, and support considerations.

category: Yearly Reconciliation of Section 7 Expenses - One Party
text: Each party pays their respective upfront share of section 7 expenses, then balances are settled annually based on proportional income share.

category: Yearly Reconciliation of Section 7 Expenses - Both Parties
text: Future section 7 expenses include agreed-upon items (e.g., tutoring, medical, extracurricular). Disputes are resolved through the Agreement's dispute resolution process.

category: Agreement as to Future Section 7 Expenses
text: Expenses not classified as section 7 include typical recurring costs such as food, clothing, field trips, and regular school supplies.

category: Agreement as to What are NOT Section 7 Expenses
text: Parties will only contribute to future section 7 expenses if they provide written consent in advance. Consent will not be unreasonably withheld.
Child support terminates upon specific events including: turning 18, becoming self-supporting, marriage, or death, unless exceptions apply.
Child support terminates when a child is no longer defined as a 'child of the marriage' or equivalent under provincial legislation.
Upon a terminating event, the responsible party must notify the other in writing. Failure to notify may result in reimbursement of overpaid support and legal costs.
If support obligations end for one child, the parties will review support for remaining children. Disagreements are resolved via dispute resolution.

category: Determining Child Support for Remaining Children
text: Support may resume if a child who left school later returns full-time and is still under the defined age limit.

category: Support Resumes if Child Returns to School
text: Post-secondary education requires reviewing support amounts and adjusting based on reduced home expenses and new education costs.

category: Review if Child Lives at Home
text: Full Table support continues during post-secondary education if the child remains at home with a parent or both parties.

category: Review if Child Lives away from Home
text: When a child lives away for school, monthly support is adjusted or paused for specific months and blended over the year if needed.
Each party contributes a percentage of the child’s post-secondary educational expenses based on agreed ratios or actual income.
RESP contributions and balances are applied before allocating remaining educational costs. Reimbursement follows contribution ratios.
The parties will consider the child's reasonable financial contribution before allocating education expenses. Disputes go to mediation/arbitration.
Parties agree to review child support annually upon request. If no agreement is reached, dispute resolution will be used.
Parties exchange income information annually by May 1st. Adjusted support and section 7 expense contributions take effect July 1st.
Each party must disclose tax returns, earnings, and financial data under s. 21(1) of the Guidelines annually or within 30 days of request.
Each party must provide additional disclosure annually, including full income documentation, benefits, self-employment details, trust statements, and financial information relevant to child support.

category: Variation Because of Change of Income
text: Parties will determine the Table amount of child support annually based on actual income and exchange of tax returns by May 1st (or June 15th if self-employed).
If underpayment of Table support is discovered, the payor will pay the balance immediately or within 30 days.
If overpayment occurred, the overpaying party may deduct the excess from future support in equal installments.
If parties disagree on the child support adjustment, they will use the Agreement’s dispute resolution clause to resolve the issue.
Either party may seek a variation of child support due to a material change in condition, needs, means, or other circumstances.
Material change can be foreseeable or unforeseeable, including significant income shifts, hardship, parenting time changes, or health changes.

category: What does not constitute a material change
text: Certain events do NOT qualify as material change, including minor income drops, short-term sabbaticals, or typical seasonal earnings.
A party requesting change must notify the other in writing, provide evidence, and request necessary supporting information.
If the parties cannot agree on changes to support, the matter will be resolved through dispute resolution.
Child support is indexed annually starting on [date]. Increases align with the Consumer Price Index from three months prior to the indexing date.

category: Increase Other Than by Indexing Factor
text: The Table amount may alternatively be increased based on the actual annual increase in the payor's income, if less than the indexing factor.
To adjust by income rather than CPI, the payor must disclose tax returns and supporting financial documents for the past two years.
If neither party initiates a review in a given year, the indexed adjustment applies automatically per the Agreement.
In shared parenting time arrangements, each party is entitled to 50% of applicable child-related tax credits and benefits.
One party may claim any tax credits for low-income families, if applicable, as agreed.
One or both parties may claim the Eligible Dependant Credit depending on which child(ren) primarily reside with each.
Tax credits and child benefits do not affect the Table amount of child support unless specifically stated otherwise.
Parties may claim federal and provincial tax benefits for children living primarily with them, including Canada Child Benefit and GST/HST credits.
Charitable donation credits for religious school tuition will be shared in proportion to the amount paid by each party.
If the child’s tuition tax credit is not fully used, either party may claim the unused portion if eligible.

category: Payment of Support through Maintenance Enforcement Agency
text: Child support will be paid through and enforced by the MAINTENANCE ENFORCEMENT AGENCY, and this Agreement will be filed with the court and agency.

category: Direct payment or Registration with Maintenance Enforcement
text: If direct payment is agreed upon, either party may register this Agreement with the MAINTENANCE ENFORCEMENT AGENCY in case of default.
By December 1st annually, the payor will issue twelve post-dated cheques for child support for the following year.
If any cheque is returned NSF or unprocessable, the payor will reimburse the recipient for all resulting bank charges.
Child support may be paid via e-transfer to the recipient’s specified email address on the first day of each month.
Child support may be paid by direct deposit from the payor’s bank to the recipient’s account on the first day of each month.
Interest at [number]% per year, compounded annually, will apply to any late child support payments, from default date to payment date.
In full satisfaction of spousal support obligations, a lump sum payment of $[amount] will be made at signing [and additional amount on (date)].
Interest on unpaid support balance will accrue at [number]% annually, compounded [monthly/annually], until paid.
Spousal support will be $[amount] per month, starting [date] and ending [date]. On that date, support ends permanently and is non-variable.
Spousal support of $[amount] per month begins on [date], with ongoing monthly payments on the first of each month.
Support is $[amount]/month starting [date], subject to review after [number] years. Disputes to be resolved under Dispute Resolution clause.

category: 3rd Party Payments re: Matrimonial Home (no children)
text: From [date] until sale of the matrimonial home, one party will cover realty taxes, utilities, insurance, and mortgage interest. These payments are deductible under Income Tax Act sections 56.1(2) and 60.1(2).
From [date] to [date], one party will pay specific spousal support-related expenses. Payments qualify for income tax treatment as support under the Act.
From [date] to [date], specified expenses will be paid but will not be treated as taxable income or deductions.
Spousal support previously paid since [date] is deemed compliant under this Agreement and the Income Tax Act. Deduction and inclusion rules apply.
The payor will reimburse the recipient for extra income tax incurred due to retroactive spousal support, including penalties and interest if applicable.
Both parties will register their child and spousal support arrangements with CRA using Form T1158.
Upon request, the payor must provide an annual statement of spousal support received.
Spousal support terminates upon: (a) death of either party; (b) final payment on [date]; (c) death of payor without insurance; (d) court/arbitrator determination.
Recipient must actively pursue self-sufficiency and provide evidence every 6 months of efforts to secure employment or retraining.
If recipient's income exceeds $[amount], the payor must be notified. Income documentation must be provided upon request.
Spousal support may be reduced by $0.50 for every dollar that recipient’s income exceeds $[threshold]. Adjustment takes effect the following month.
Overpayments of spousal support may be deducted over [number] months. If the obligation has ended, immediate repayment is required.
Spousal support may be varied upon a material change in circumstances, including financial, child support, remarriage, cohabitation, or health.
Any party seeking a change must notify the other in writing with evidence and a request for needed information.

category: What Does NOT Constitute Material Change
text: Spousal support will not change due to non-material events such as short-term cohabitation or income drops under a threshold.

category: Variation of Support in Event of Retirement
text: Spousal support may be changed in the event of voluntary or involuntary retirement. Voluntary retirement requires 6 months’ written notice and applies prospectively.
In the case of involuntary retirement, written notice must be provided immediately, and changes will apply from the date of retirement or notice, whichever is later.
Retiring party must submit a sworn Financial Statement and all relevant retirement benefit documentation.
Pension benefits already equalized under this Agreement are excluded from retirement income when reviewing spousal support changes.

category: No Obligation to Notify of Changes Until Review Requested
text: No obligation exists to disclose financial changes unless review clauses are activated, except in the case of retirement.
If child support ends or is reduced, and spousal support was reduced to accommodate child support, a review of spousal support may be requested.
Spousal support is suspended while recipient is cohabiting with another person in a relationship resembling marriage. Support may be reinstated if cohabitation ends.
If recipient is entitled to support from a new cohabitating partner, the current payor will not be obligated to continue payments.
Either party may request a review of spousal support on a specified date, when child support ends or is reduced, or upon changes in cohabitation status.

category: Review when last child starts school
text: Spousal support may be reviewed when the youngest child starts school or turns age 12, or other triggering events listed in the Agreement occur.
If parties are unable to agree on spousal support after a triggering event, the matter will be resolved under the Dispute Resolution section.
Until adjusted by agreement, arbitration, or court order, spousal support continues under the most recent terms in force.
Spousal support is indexed annually starting [date]. Adjustments use the CPI from three months before the indexing date.

category: Increase other than by Indexing Factor
text: Alternatively, spousal support may be increased by the actual percentage increase in payor’s income for the prior year, if less than the CPI.
To apply income-based indexing, the payor must submit income tax returns and supporting documentation from the last two years.
Index-based support increases require an amending agreement to be signed and filed with the court and enforcement agency.
Late spousal support payments will accrue interest at [number]% per year, compounded annually.

category: If Support Arrears Paid in Lump Sum
text: If arrears are paid late in a lump sum causing increased taxes, the payor will reimburse the excess tax burden as liquidated damages.
If the payor defaults on support, they are liable for all legal fees and expenses incurred by the recipient to enforce payment.

category: Payment of Support through Enforcement Agency
text: Spousal support will be enforced by the MAINTENANCE ENFORCEMENT AGENCY and this Agreement will be filed accordingly. Automatic deductions may apply.

category: Direct Payment of Support/Non-filing with Enforcement Agency
text: Spousal support may be paid directly rather than through the enforcement agency, unless default occurs for more than [number] weeks—then enforcement may proceed.
By December 1st each year, the payor must provide twelve post-dated cheques for spousal support for the upcoming year.
If a cheque is returned or unprocessable, the payor is responsible for all related bank fees incurred by the recipient.
Spousal support may be paid via e-transfer to the recipient’s designated email address on the first day of each month.
Spousal support may be paid by direct deposit from the payor’s bank to the recipient’s bank on the first day of each month.
Neither party will apply to a provincial or federal court to vary spousal support terms except as provided by this Agreement and under the specified provincial legislation.
Upon the terms of this Agreement, the parties release all present and future claims to spousal support, retroactively and prospectively. They are now financially independent.

category: Intention to Release of Spousal Support
text: The parties intend this Agreement to be final, binding, and non-variable in all respects regarding spousal support.
Each party confirms that they received independent legal advice, negotiated fairly, and believe the Agreement equitably reflects the consequences of their relationship.

category: No Variation of Spousal Support Release Permitted
text: Even in the face of extreme, unforeseen, or catastrophic changes in life circumstances, neither party will be entitled to seek spousal support. Financial independence remains absolute.

category: Repayment of Equalization if Spousal Support Ordered
text: If any court ever awards spousal support despite this Agreement, the equalization payment must be returned and recalculated.
Parties acknowledge court rulings that override releases but agree this Agreement is to be enforced as a complete defense to any future spousal support claim.
This Dispute Resolution section applies to disputes or proposed changes relating to reviewable or variable terms, relocations, and significant parenting changes.
If a dispute arises, parties must first attempt negotiation directly or through counsel. The initiating party must provide written notice, evidence, and any relevant information requests.

The responding party must answer within a set number of days. The parties will meet personally or via representatives to resolve the matter. Any resolution will be formalized in an amending agreement signed before witnesses.
If negotiation fails, the parties will engage a mutually agreed-upon mediator. Costs will be shared equally or as specified, and a mediation agreement will be signed.
If mediation fails, the parties will engage a mediator/arbitrator. The process will follow the Arbitration Act and result in a binding award unless appealed under law.
If unresolved through prior steps, the parties will engage an arbitrator under the Arbitration Act. The decision is binding and may be appealed on specific grounds.
If all alternative resolution methods fail, either party may apply to court with at least [number] days’ written notice.

"Medical needs" include all mental and physical health services such as prescriptions, dental, vision, therapy, and alternative care. "Health insurance" includes medical, dental, and extended benefits.
If neither party has health insurance, each is responsible for their own medical needs.
The supporting party must maintain the recipient as a beneficiary under their employment health insurance plan, for as long as coverage is available.
If allowed, the supporting party will authorize direct claims by the recipient to the insurer and direct reimbursement to the recipient.
If direct claim is not possible, the supporting party will submit receipts and forward reimbursements promptly via endorsement or e-transfer.
If health insurance lapses, replacement private insurance must be obtained immediately, provided it's reasonably available.
If coverage ceases, written notice must be given. Medical costs incurred before notice must be reimbursed. Afterward, each party covers their own needs.

category: Termination of Coverage When Spousal Support Ends
text: Once spousal support ends, the payor may remove the recipient from health insurance coverage after 30 days’ notice.
If neither party has health insurance, and support for a child continues, they will share the child’s medical costs equally or in proportion to income.
The supporting party must keep the child listed as a beneficiary under employment insurance for as long as support is required.
Both parties may hold the child as a beneficiary under their respective plans. Reimbursement claims and payments must be coordinated cooperatively.
If neither plan is available, the obligated party must acquire private insurance for the child, if reasonably available.
If coverage ends unexpectedly, written notice is required. Medical costs incurred before notice must be reimbursed. Future expenses are shared based on agreement.
Orthodontic costs will be paid with prior written consent from the other party, not to be unreasonably withheld. Disputes go to resolution.
Uncovered medical costs will be shared equally or in proportion, unless pre-approval was not obtained. Disputes go to resolution.

category: Termination Of Coverage When Child Support Ends
text: Once child support ends, 30 days’ written notice allows removal of the child from the payor’s health plan.
Parties without insurance must each pay their own medical costs and share child-related expenses based on agreement or section 7 rules.
While support is owed, parties must maintain the supported child as a health insurance beneficiary and handle claims/reimbursements cooperatively.

category: Spouse and Both to Maintain Health Insurance for Children
text: If both parents support the same child, both will maintain the child under insurance. Reimbursement must be prompt and coordinated.
If insurance becomes unavailable, new private coverage must be obtained immediately to avoid coverage gaps, provided it is reasonably priced.
Written notice is required if coverage ends. Parties will reimburse costs incurred before notice and share expenses thereafter.
Orthodontic treatment will be covered with prior consent. If the parties cannot agree, dispute resolution is required.
Uninsured medical expenses are shared equally or in proportion. Consent must be obtained beforehand unless the issue is resolved through dispute resolution.

category: Termination of Coverage When Support Ends
text: Spousal support ending allows removal of the recipient from health coverage with 30 days’ notice.
Child support ending allows removal of the child from health insurance with 30 days’ notice.
The insurer must notify the other party in writing of any changes or termination of health coverage in a timely manner.
If a party fails to maintain required insurance, they must repay the other for any resulting losses or uncovered expenses.
A party owns a life insurance policy through employment in the amount of $[amount]. The full face value is available and unencumbered.
A party will apply for a life insurance policy in the amount of $[amount], and undergo any required medical exams.
Parties will jointly apply for life insurance on one party’s life in the amount of $[amount], with shared ownership as specified (e.g., joint tenancy).
The policyholder must pay premiums on time. If another party pays to prevent lapse, the amount is treated as support and reimbursable.
The policy must remain active during and for one year following support obligations. Beneficiary must be irrevocably designated as security for child support.
Trustees may be appointed to manage insurance proceeds on behalf of children, with detailed trust terms attached or referenced.

category: Life Insurance to Secure Spousal Support
text: If obligated to pay spousal support, the policyholder will keep the policy active and designate the recipient as irrevocable beneficiary for outstanding obligations.

category: Proof of Policy and [Irrevocable] Beneficiary Designation
text: Prior to signing, the policyholder will provide a copy of the policy and irrevocable beneficiary designation, and sign an Authorization and Direction form.
Annual proof of premium payment will be provided within 14 days of each policy anniversary.

category: Release of Irrevocable Beneficiary Designation - Individual Policy
text: Once support obligations end, the policyholder may terminate the irrevocable beneficiary designation. If refused, a court order may be pursued.

category: Alternate - Release of Interest - Joint Policy
text: Upon termination of support, the policyholder will transfer policy ownership. If refused, a court order may be obtained at the refusing party’s cost.
If the existing policy lapses or cannot be maintained, replacement insurance must be secured immediately at a reasonable cost.
If the policyholder dies, their estate continues paying support obligations until insurance proceeds are received.
If the required policy is not in force at death, the recipient has a lien against the estate for the full amount of support owed.
The policy amount may be reviewed every [number] years to determine if a change is warranted based on remaining support obligations and other factors.

category: Automatic Reduction of Policy Amount by Specified Amount or Percentage
text: The policy amount may be automatically reduced every [number] years by $[amount] or by [percentage] %.

category: Alternate - Automatic Reduction of Policy Amount according to Schedule
text: A fixed schedule may be used to reduce the required policy amount, beginning on a specified date with set reduction amounts.

category: Review if Material Increase in Premium Payments
text: If premiums increase materially, the parties may renegotiate policy terms or cost-sharing. Disputes will be resolved via dispute resolution clause.

category: Variable if Material Change in Circumstances
text: The amount of required insurance is variable and subject to adjustment in the event of a material change in circumstances.
Any issue regarding insurance coverage amount or changes will be resolved using the dispute resolution procedures in the Agreement.
The parties have agreed on a division of property based on the attached calculations and will divide property accordingly.
A payment of $[amount] will be made via certified cheque by [date/time] to complete the property equalization settlement.
This payment satisfies all equalization claims of the INSERT PROVINCIAL LEGISLATION NAME HERE, unless otherwise addressed in the pension section.
If payment is late, interest at [rate]% applies after 14 days. Full payment may be accelerated, and additional penalties may apply including suspension of spousal support release.
To secure payment, the RRSP plan holder will restrict RRSP transfers without written consent until all payments under this Agreement are complete.
Investment account assets will be transferred in equal shares between the parties as of a specified valuation date.
Joint bank accounts will be divided equally unless otherwise specified. Individual accounts will remain with their respective owners.
RRSP transfers under section 146(16) of the Income Tax Act will be completed, including execution of Form T2220 and tax-free rollover.
The recipient of the RRSP transfer is responsible for any taxes or fees on collapse or transfer, except their own income tax.
Corporate shares will be transferred to the transferee who will assume all liabilities. The transferor will resign from all positions and release future claims.

category: Transfer of Capital Property as a Rollover
text: Capital assets may be transferred on a tax-free rollover basis.

category: Alternate - Transfer of Capital Property with Joint Election
text: Joint election under s. 74.5(3)(b) of the Income Tax Act will be filed to avoid attribution of taxable capital gains. The transferee indemnifies the transferor.

category: Alternate - Transfer of Capital Property at Fair Market Value
text: A capital asset may be transferred at fair market value. The transferor may elect out of rollover provisions under s. 73(1) of the Income Tax Act.
Vehicle ownership will be transferred. The original owner will cover any transfer documentation and indemnify the new owner from liabilities until insured.
Airline rewards will be equalized by direct transfer, cash equivalent, or booking travel of equivalent value depending on program rules.
The transferor declares no prior income tax liabilities. Any liability arising from transferred property will be indemnified by the transferor and enforceable by judgment.
Spousal support and property provisions are interdependent. Together they satisfy support objectives under the Divorce Act and provincial legislation.

The support and property sections are interdependent and fulfill objectives under the Divorce Act by recognizing economic impact, allocating child-related financial burdens, relieving hardship, and promoting self-sufficiency.

The Agreement satisfies support objectives under the INSERT PROVINCIAL LEGISLATION NAME HERE by recognizing each party’s contribution, sharing child support burdens, encouraging independence, and relieving financial hardship.

category: Intention of Agreement to be Binding
text: All property, income tax, and financial transfers set out in this Agreement are binding and enforceable as final settlement unless otherwise varied by mutual agreement or court order.
The parties own the matrimonial home jointly or as tenants-in-common.
One party is the sole registered owner of the matrimonial home.
The joint tenancy in the matrimonial home is severed, and it is now held as tenants-in-common.
Upon signing the Agreement, a party will transfer full title of the matrimonial home to the other, free of encumbrances, and cover related costs.

category: Alternate - Transfer of Home for Value
text: One party transfers their interest in the matrimonial home to the other for a set amount or calculated value. Transfer costs are allocated.

category: Mutual Transfer of Home and Cottage
text: Both matrimonial home and cottage transfers will be completed upon signing, with parties covering registration costs as agreed.
Any encumbrance registered after signing and before transfer must be cleared by the responsible party, who will indemnify the other.
The parties agree on the matrimonial home's value, optionally based on a designated appraiser.

category: Alternate - Value of Matrimonial Home by Jointly Retained Appraiser
text: If no agreed value, the matrimonial home will be appraised jointly. If appraisals differ, the average or third-party appraisal determines the value.
If one party is buying out the other, deductions may apply for notional real estate commission and legal expenses.
Responsibility for existing mortgage payments, penalties, fees, and discharge lies with the assuming party. They will indemnify the other if a release is not secured.

category: Alternate - Existing Mortgage - Release or Refinance
text: If mortgage release is not obtained, the responsible party must refinance and discharge the existing mortgage.
Both parties designate the home as their principal residence up to the transfer date. Any tax from breach will be reimbursed by the breaching party.

category: Date for Completion of Transfer and Sanctions for Delay
text: Transfer of the matrimonial home must be completed within 60 days of signing the Agreement. Sanctions apply if not completed on time.

category: Release Property Rights in the Matrimonial Home
text: Once transfer is complete, the transferor releases all rights under the INSERT PROVINCIAL LEGISLATION NAME HERE.
Parties will list the matrimonial home for sale by a specified date and accept the first reasonable offer. Disputes go to resolution.
If the sale cannot be agreed upon, the parties consent to a judicial sale under provincial legislation. Either may apply to court.
One party may retain exclusive possession of the matrimonial home until closing, covering daily expenses and sharing major expenses as agreed.
"Daily household expenses" include utilities, internet, security, and small repairs. "Major repairs" are defined separately and exclude cosmetic upgrades.
Daily expenses will be paid by the party in exclusive possession.
Major expenses will be split equally or in a specified ratio. One party may cover and be reimbursed from sale proceeds.
Neither party will incur major home expenses without the other's written consent.
Proceeds from sale will first pay sale-related expenses, agreed reimbursements, and joint debt before the balance is divided equally or as agreed.
While a party has exclusive possession, the other will co-sign or guarantee mortgage renewals/replacements up to a specified amount.

category: Indemnity for any losses from Mortgage renewal
text: The guaranteeing party is indemnified from any loss or liability resulting from the mortgage guarantee.
Until sale, parties hold title as joint tenants or tenants-in-common. Severance restrictions may apply.
The home will be sold when the youngest child finishes school, one party remarries or cohabits, or by a specific date.
Household contents have been divided to the parties’ mutual satisfaction.
Household contents have been divided per the attached Schedule to this Agreement.
Parties agree to divide household contents equally and execute an acknowledgment. If they cannot agree, they will resolve it via dispute resolution.
The parties have joint debts listed in the Agreement. Each assumes responsibility for specific debts and agrees to use best efforts to release the other from liability.
Until released from a joint debt, neither party will incur additional charges on the account. The responsible party will indemnify the other.
Each party will be solely responsible for their personal debts and will indemnify the other from any liability related to those debts.
All jointly held credit cards will be cancelled upon signing this Agreement. Each party assumes the balance for designated accounts.
If a party becomes liable for a credit card or other debt assumed by the other, the assuming party will fully indemnify them.

category: Joint Line of Credit/Mortgage Debts Assumption and Release
text: One party will assume responsibility for shared liabilities such as a mortgage or line of credit, and will use best efforts to obtain a release for the other party.
Family loans evidenced by promissory notes are to be assumed by the designated party, who will indemnify the other and obtain a release with proof.
If one party has exclusive possession of the home, the other will remain a guarantor until released. They must sign mortgage renewals within one week of request.
Loans between the parties are forgiven where noted and no repayment will be expected.
Neither party may pledge or bind the other's credit after the signing of this Agreement. Both confirm no such pledges have occurred since separation.
A party obligated to indemnify must reimburse all losses, expenses, or legal fees incurred by the other, and pay interest on amounts covered under this Agreement.
Either party may apply for a division of Canada Pension Plan credits.

category: Pension under the Provincial Pensions - Intention to Equalize and Divide Pension
text: Where pension value is not included in net family property, it will be divided according to the Pension Benefits Act (PBA) and Agreement terms.

category: Intention to Equalize/Divide Pension as Part of Property Equalization
text: Where pension value is to be equalized, it will be valued but not divided. It will be included in net family property and equalized accordingly.
Definitions such as AVCs, EMCs, Family Law Valuation Date, Plan, Plan Administrator, and transfer ratio apply to all pension-related clauses.
The Family Law Valuation Date is the agreed or court-ordered date of separation for pension valuation purposes.

category: Maximum transferable value specified in Pension Division Letter
text: The maximum transferable value from the Plan to the non-member is specified, with options such as LIRA, LIF, RRSP, or another pension plan.
The transfer will be made as a lump sum to a registered account designated by the non-member spouse.
Parties agree to cooperate fully, complete all forms, and submit documentation to facilitate pension transfer.

category: No party to jeopardize pension division
text: No party will take actions that jeopardize pension division. If they do, remedies such as support recalculation or equalization adjustment may apply.
If the pension member dies before the lump sum is transferred, the value will be paid to the estate of the non-member.
All transfers are in pre-tax dollars. Tax consequences are accounted for in the equalization or as separately addressed.

category: Division Option 1 - Division of Pension Instalments
text: Where a retired pension is already in pay, instalments may be divided or converted into a combined pension payable to the recipient.

category: Division of installments  - Arrears in payment
text: Arrears from the valuation date to transfer date may be recovered through increased instalments to the non-member and decreased instalments to the member.

category: Pension Administrator to be Directed by Agreement
text: The Plan Administrator will be directed to act in accordance with the Agreement, including adjusting payments for arrears and enforcing division terms.
Waivers of survivor benefits may be executed using prescribed forms. The waiver terms vary depending on the pension's pay status and the agreement structure.
If one party dies before waiver or transfer is complete, alternative outcomes such as transfer to estate or cancellation of division may apply.
The Agreement may allow a combined pension to be paid in lieu of dividing instalments or survivor benefits.
All pension division-related applications, will be completed as required.

category: No Division of Pension Benefits/Pension by Plan Administrator
text: If no division is pursued through the PBA, parties agree to equalize pension value through net family property instead.
Additional Voluntary Contributions (AVCs) and Excess Member Contributions (EMCs) earned during the relationship are equalized through property division.

category: Equalization of Family Law Value of Spouse's Survivor Benefits
text: Survivor benefits are considered part of net family property and included in the equalization payment.
Any pension transfer made under the PBA is in before-tax dollars, and tax adjustments have been applied in the equalization calculation.
One party waives all claims to survivor benefits and acknowledges they are not entitled to joint or survivor benefits under the Plan.
If the pension is already in pay, the parties will execute Pension Form (Post-retirement Waiver) to formally waive survivor benefits.
If the pension is not to be divided, the parties will execute Pension Form FL-8 and submit it to the Plan Administrator to waive survivor entitlements.
After pension transfers or divisions are complete, all further claims to the pension, including survivor and death benefits, are fully released.
"PBDA" means the Pension Benefits Division Act. This governs public service pensions subject to federal division rules.
The Plan under PBDA is a federally regulated pension such as one governed by the Public Service Superannuation Act or Supplementary Retirement Benefits Act.

category: 50% of pension is due to the non-member
text: The parties confirm the pension was accumulated during the relationship and that 50% is due to the non-member, either now or upon division.

category: Federal Pension not included in Net Family Property
text: Pension value will not be included in net family property but instead paid directly under the PBDA and per this Agreement.

category: Either Party Can Apply for division
text: Either party may apply under section 4(1) of the PBDA for division of pension benefits. Both parties will fully cooperate.
The application to divide PBDA benefits includes confirmation of separation, addresses, dates of birth, employer info, and waiver of objections under PBDA.

category: Minister to transfer 50% of pension value to non-member
text: The Minister will transfer 50% of the pension value earned during the relationship into a registered retirement vehicle selected by the non-member.

category: Maximum Transferable Amount -Shortfall Paid by Member
text: If the maximum transferable amount under provincial legislation is less than agreed pension value, the member party will pay the difference to the other.
Transferred pension funds are in before-tax dollars. Equalization calculations reflect the gross value.
A specified lump sum will be transferred to a retirement account of the non-member, pursuant to PBDA rules.
If the non-member dies before transfer completion, the funds will be transferred to their estate.
Until transfer is complete, the member acts as trustee for the other party’s interest and must ensure all communications are shared.

category: Authority to Release Information to Other Party
text: The member must authorize the Plan to release information directly to the other party and notify the administrator of all pension terms in this Agreement.
If the member fails to comply with trust terms, the other party may obtain a court order without notice to protect their pension interest.
The pension member irrevocably directs the Plan Administrator to comply with the terms of this Agreement and protect the non-member’s pension interests.
The member must designate the non-member as irrevocable beneficiary of $[amount] in life insurance to secure pension-related obligations if they die before obligations are satisfied.

category: When Pension Division Cannot be Completed
text: If the agreed method of pension division cannot be completed, the non-member retains a 50% interest in benefits earned during the relationship.
If the parties cannot agree on alternative pension arrangements, the issue will be resolved by Dispute Resolution or a court of competent jurisdiction.

text: This Agreement satisfies all claims previously made in Court File No. [court file number] in the [specify court] at [City, Province].
